sn55.30:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
sn55.30:1.2: Then Nandaka the Licchavi minister went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
sn55.30:2.1: “Nandaka, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.30:2.3: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.30:2.7: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.30:2.8: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.30:3.1: A noble disciple who has these four things is guaranteed long life,
sn55.30:3.5: and sovereignty, both human and divine.
sn55.30:3.6: Now, I don’t say this because I’ve heard it from some other ascetic or brahmin. I only say it because I’ve known, seen, and realized it for myself.”
sn55.30:4.1: When he had spoken, a certain person said to Nandaka:
sn55.30:4.3: “Enough now, my man, with that exterior bath.
